Class SplashWindow1

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window

            • ISP.classes.SplashWindow1
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer

     class SplashWindow1
extends javax.swing.JWindow
    This class displays the splashscreen at the beginning of the program.
    Version:
    1.0 June 11th 2013 Thanks to Tony Colston for his code which I used as a baseline.
    Author:
    Jonah Haber, Reyno Tilikaynen, Tony Colston

    • Constructor Detail

      • SplashWindow1

        public SplashWindow1(java.lang.String filename,
             javax.swing.JFrame f)
        Displays the splash screen and after 5 seconds goes to the program itself.

        Creates the splash screen by creating a JWindow, loading the image and displaying it in the middle of the screen.

        The splash screen lasts 5 seconds and then dissapears.

        Variable Dictionary:

        Name Type Description

        l JLabel Stores the image with the given filename. screenSize Dimensions Stores the dimensions of the screen. labelSize Dimensions Stores the dimensions of the image. sd InterruptedException Stores the exception thrown by the Thread.sleep () method.

        Parameters:
        filename - The name of image to be displayed.
        f - The JFrame this splash screen is associated to.
